title: Sanders remains undrafted as free fall continues
content: Shedeur Sanders remained undrafted entering the fourth round of the NFL draft. Coverage resumes Saturday at noon ET on ESPN.

title: Payton: 'Beware' if you snubbed Sanders in draft
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said teams that passed over Shedeur Sanders in the NFL draft should "beware" because the ex-Colorado QB will use the snub as motivation.

title: Celts vent after loss: Refs not controlling play
content: Through three games of this first-round series, the seventh-seeded Magic have displayed a physical style of basketball that the defending champion Celtics say they believe is over the line.

title: Harmon's mom died after Steelers picked her son
content: Tiffany Saine, the mother of Steelers first-round pick Derrick Harmon, died Thursday night shortly after her son was selected No. 21 in the NFL draft.

title: Saints invest in QB room, draft Shough at 40
content: The Saints bypassed Sanders for the second time in as many nights Friday, selecting Louisville's Tyler Shough with the 40th pick in the NFL draft.

title: Sapped by stomach bug, Luka struggles in G3 loss
content: A visibly ill Luka Doncic played through a stomach ailment and was limited to 17 points in a 116-104 Game 3 loss to the Wolves.

title: Boone to mull Yanks' closer as Williams flops again
content: Devin Williams' continued struggles in the ninth prompted Yankees manager Aaron Boone to say "we'll see" when asked if the team would consider making a switch at closer.

title: Taylor, Hall of Fame DE's son, drafted by Jets
content: The Jets selected Mason Taylor, the son of Hall of Famer Jason Taylor, in the second round of the NFL draft.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB
content: Chicago has scored more runs than any team in the majors so far -- with the help of some unexpected sluggers.

title: Slow start? Not this year! Francisco Lindor has Mets rolling
content: After stumbling out of the gate last season, the star shortstop and his team are lighting up Citi Field.

title: Luka, LeBron and the most dangerous 60-foot passes in the game
content: These mega-outlets illustrate a growing Lakers connection that should strike fear across the NBA. And they're only going to happen more.

title: Madrid to play Copa final despite protest over refs
content: Real Madrid denied they were considering boycotting Saturday's Copa del Rey final against Barcelona, despite protesting comments made by the refereeing team.

title: Senator wants travel policies eased before '26 WC
content: Sen. Ron Wyden of Oregon has asked top Trump administration officials to reconsider policies that are impacting travelers arriving in the United States, citing upcoming sporting events like the 2026 World Cup.

title: Pride stage late comeback, avoid 2nd straight loss
content: Defending NWSL champions Orlando Pride rallied with three goals in the last 20 minutes to secure a 3-2 victory and avoid consecutive defeats after ending their 23-game unbeaten streak last week.

title: Evra eyes Suárez MMA fight: 'He can even bite me'
content: Former Manchester United defender Patrice Evra will make his debut as an MMA fighter in a "showcase bout" on May 23 in Paris, the PFL has announced.

title: Reynolds: Wrexham promotion bid given me ulcer
content: Wrexham co-owner Ryan Reynolds has said the crucial last weeks of Wrexham's bid for promotion have developed "an eight-inch ulcer in my stomach."

title: Nice end PSG's hopes of unbeaten Ligue 1 season
content: Paris Saint-Germain's hopes of becoming the first side to complete a Ligue 1 season unbeaten came crashing down at the Parc des Princes on Friday when Nice handed them their first defeat of the league campaign.

title: Chelsea-bound Estêvão scores, vomits in Copa win
content: Palmeiras' Estêvão had an 18th birthday to remember, netting the club's second goal in a 3-2 Copa Libertadores win over Bolivar before dropping to the turf, vomiting and leaving the field on a stretcher as the high altitude of La Paz took its toll.

title: NWSL seeks to launch second division in 2026
content: The National Women's Soccer League has formally applied to the U.S. Soccer Federation to create a new Division II league.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: 2025 NFL draft: Fantasy football analysis of Rounds 1-3
content: Liz Loza, Matt Bowen and Mike Clay break down the fantasy potential of early-round rookies from the NFL draft and provide initial 2025 projections.

title: Jim Schlossnagle is at the center of the Texas-Texas A&M storm
content: As if the Texas-Texas A&M rivalry needed more, Jim Schlossnagle's decision to switch rivals adds all the extra drama.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs odds: Stars a top-5 favorite after Game 3 win over Avalanche
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: How Lewis Hamilton helped Damson Idris and Brad Pitt bring 'F1' movie to life
content: With real race cars and Lewis Hamilton advising, Damson Idris talks the realism of filming June's "F1" movie.

title: Chris Eubank Jr.-Conor Benn timeline: How their rivalry unfolded
content: Nick Parkinson looks at the rivalry between Eubank and Benn that started decades ago between their fathers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Bayern eyeing Nkunku
content: Arsenal and Bayern Munich are reportedly ready to compete to sign Chelsea's Christopher Nkunku in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 26/11 terror attack accused Rana not cooperating with investigation: Police
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key figure in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is reportedly not cooperating with investigators, offering evasive answers during questioning. An Indian court denied Rana's request to speak with his family, citing concerns about potential information leaks.

title: ‘Drown in it’: Delhi min's fiery retort to Bhutto's threat on Indus waters treaty
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, Delhi minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa strongly criticized Pakistan's Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari's threats. Sirsa condemned Pakistan's support for terrorism and warned its officials against provocative actions, as protests erupted in London over the killings. The escalating tensions highlight the strained relationship between the two nations.

title: Elon Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Sexual assault: Minor files plaint, 2 men slashed her with blade in Chennai
content: In Chennai, a teenage girl was attacked with a blade by two men near Washermenpet on Thursday night. The assault was retaliation for her sexual assault complaint against their 35-year-old brother, which led to his arrest.

title: No OPTion left: New bill trumps US dreams for Telugu students
content: A proposed US bill threatens the Optional Practical Training (OPT) program, causing anxiety among Indian students, particularly from Telugu states, who rely on it for post-study work opportunities. Many students are reconsidering their US education plans, fearing they won't be able to repay hefty loans without OPT.

title: 14 types of visas cancelled for Pak nationals: Who has to leave and by when?
content: India has suspended visa services for Pakistani nationals and revoked most existing visas, excluding long-term, diplomatic, and official ones, following a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir. Pakistani nationals with SAARC, business, or medical visas must leave India by specific deadlines in late April.

title: Billionaire Harsh Goenka shares stock market tip: 'Yaad Rakho…'
content: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka recently shared his insights on navigating the stock market's volatility, drawing a humorous comparison to Bollywood stars. He advised retail investors to view market downturns as opportunities to buy quality stocks at discounted prices.

title: Actor Ranya Rao bail plea rejected in gold smuggling case
content: The Karnataka High Court has denied bail to actress Harshavardhini Ranya Rao and Tarun Konduru Raju, who are accused in a gold smuggling case. Ranya Rao was apprehended on March 3, 2025, with over 14 kg of gold concealed on her person. The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) highlighted the duo's frequent travels to Dubai and presented evidence of the arrest memo being properly served.

title: Don't want to go to Pakistan, I am India's daughter-in law now: Seema Haider
content: Seema Haider, who illegally entered India from Pakistan to marry Sachin Meena, fears deportation after India suspended visa services for Pakistani nationals following the Pahalgam terror attack. She appeals to PM Modi and UP CM Yogi to allow her to stay, claiming she is now India's daughter-in-law and has embraced Hinduism.

title: 'Not interested in playing in India': Pakistan cricketer sparks controversy
content: Amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistan's Gull Feroza confirmed their women's cricket team will not play in India during the upcoming World Cup. Echoing PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi's stance, Feroza stated a preference for Asian conditions, suggesting Sri Lanka or Dubai as potential neutral venues. Earlier this year, the Indian men's team also declined to travel to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy. As a result, their matches—including the final—were held in Dubai.

title: How China is trying to stop Apple’s ‘big’ iPhone move to India
content: Apple is accelerating its iPhone production shift to India, aiming to manufacture all US-bound iPhones there by 2026 due to US tariffs on Chinese imports. This ambitious plan requires doubling India's current iPhone output.

title: President Murmu, Trump, Zelenskyy: List of world leaders attending Pope's funeral
content: World leaders and dignitaries have converged on St. Peter's Square to honor Pope Francis, who passed away at 88 from heart failure. The funeral ceremony, attended by figures like Donald Trump, Emmanuel Macron, and President Murmu of India, marks a significant moment of global mourning. Notable absences include Vladimir Putin and Benjamin Netanyahu due to international arrest warrants.

title: PM Modi Distributes Over 51,000 Appointment Letters At 15th Rozgar Mela
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi distributed 51,236 appointment letters to newly-recruited candidates in central government departments and organisations as part of the 15th Rozgar Mela, organised on Saturday.

title: Making Of India's Longest Rail Tunnel In Uttarakhand: When Project Looked Jeopardised
content: The completion of India's longest rail tunnel between Devprayag and Janasu in Uttarakhand faced significant challenges, including moments when it seemed the tunnel might collapse and jeopardise the whole project, Larsen & Toubro Limited (L&T) said.

title: Updates: Pope Francis Funeral Today; President Murmu, Trump At Vatican
content: Pope Francis died at the age of 88 on April 21 due to a stroke, weeks after he returned home after battling double pneumonia.

title: World's Largest Adrenal Tumor Removed Robotically At Delhi Hospital
content: Medical Superintendent of Safdarjung Hospital, Dr Sandeep Bansal, informed that the adrenal tumour, measuring 18.2 x 13.5 cms, is the largest ever adrenal tumour in the world.

title: "Pakistan Ready For...": Shehbaz Sharif Reacts To Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif today said he his ready for a "neutral investigation" of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam where 26 people, including a Nepalese national, were gunned down.

title: Video: Pak Official's Throat-Slit Gesture At Pahalgam Attack Protestors In UK
content: Members of the Indian community were holding a protest outside the Pakistan High Commission in London against the Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir this week.

title: Mother Of Teen Accused In Pune Porsche Crash Released From Jail
content: The mother of a 17-year-old boy involved in the Pune Porsche crash, in which two persons lost their lives, walked out of jail on Saturday, four days after the Supreme Court granted her interim bail.

title: Pak Woman Seema Haider's Appeal As India Cancels Visas Over Pahalgam
content: "I was Pakistan's daughter, but now I'm India's daughter-in-law," says Seema Haider as she fears deportation after the government suspended visa services for Pakistani nationals as part of a series of retaliatory steps following the Pahalgam attack.

title: "India, Pak Fighting For 1,500 Years On Border": Trump After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Without mentioning Prime Minister Narendra Modi or his Pakistani counterpart Shehbaz Sharif, Trump said he knew both the leaders.

title: Diddy Sex Abuse Case: Jury To Watch Video Of Him Hitting Ex-Girlfriend
content: The jury in the criminal sex trafficking trial of Sean "Diddy" Combs will watch the footage of the music mogul physically assaulting his former girlfriend, Cassie Ventura, a New York judge has ruled.

title: Tahawwur Rana Not Cooperating, Giving Evasive Replies: Mumbai Police
content: Mumbai Police on Saturday said that the key conspirator of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, Tahawwur Rana was not cooperating with the investigating agencies and giving evasive replies.

title: When Pakistan Tried To Alter Line Of Control - The Siachen, Kargil Story
content: Pakistan has claimed it may put the 1972 Simla Agreement "in abeyance" after India's move to put a hold on the Indus Waters Treaty following the barbaric attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam in which 26 innocent civilians were killed.

title: The Link Between A Student Visa To Pakistan And Pahalgam Attack
content: Adil Ahmed Thoker, one of the terrorists involved in the Pahalgam massacre of April 22, which saw 26 people gunned down, went to Pakistan in 2018 and returned six years later with three to four terrorists, sources said.

title: Do you overthink a lot? Practice this technique to quiet racing thoughts
content: Battling a restless mind? Cognitive shuffling, a playful mental exercise introduced by cognitive scientist Luc Beaudoin, offers a unique solution. No one wins against a racing mind by pushing harder. Sometimes, the most effective tools are the ones that might feel effortless. That’s what makes cognitive shuffling feel so magical.

title: MS Dhoni finally loses cool after CSK loss, says 'you can't just keep ... '
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni expressed disappointment as Chennai Super Kings suffered a five-wicket defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad, further diminishing their IPL 2025 play-off hopes. Dhoni felt that their score of 154 was inadequate on the Chepauk pitch, and the team's overall performance lacked cohesion. ​​CSK, meanwhile, sit at the bottom with just two wins from nine games and only four points to show.

title: 'Reprehensible act of terrorism': UNSC strongly condemns Pahalgam attack
content: The United Nations Security Council strongly condemned the recent terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir on April 22, which resulted in at least 26 fatalities and numerous injuries. The Council emphasized the urgent need to hold the perpetrators, organizers, and financiers of this reprehensible act accountable and bring them to justice.

title: Eminent historian M G S Narayanan passes away at 93 in Kerala
content: Eminent historian M G S Narayanan, former chairman of the Indian Council of Historical Research, passed away at his residence in Kozhikode at the age of 93. Renowned for his work on Kerala's socio-political history, particularly 'Perumals of Kerala,' he headed the history department at the University of Calicut and contributed significantly to Indian historiography.

title: RJD poster targets PM Modi, Nitish for Bihar rally days after J&K attack
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar for holding a political rally in Bihar while the nation mourns the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack. RJD alleges the state administration pressured officials to ensure crowd attendance.

title: What 'busy' Donald Trump did for wife Melania Trump on her birthday
content: President Trump admitted he was too occupied to purchase a birthday gift for First Lady Melania Trump, who turned 55 on Saturday. Instead, he planned a dinner aboard Air Force One as they returned from Pope Francis’s funeral in Rome.

title: ‘Kesari 2’ box office collection: Akshay starrer makes Rs 4cr more than ‘Jaat’
content: Akshay Kumar's courtroom drama, 'Kesari Chapter 2: The Untold Story of Jallianwala Bagh,' has surpassed ₹50 crore in the domestic market after an eight-day theatrical run. The film saw a rise in collections on its second Friday, minting an estimated ₹4.15 crore. While 'Jaat' and 'Ground Zero' also released, they couldn't match 'Kesari 2's' Friday earnings.

title: 'Don't need to prove your patriotism': Yogeshwar Dutt to Neeraj
content: Yogeshwar Dutt has defended Neeraj Chopra after the javelin star faced social media abuse for inviting Pakistani athlete Arshad Nadeem to the NC Classic. Chopra clarified Nadeem's participation was impossible after the Pahalgam attack, emphasising his country's priority. Dutt lauded Chopra's patriotism and leadership, urging him to ignore critics and continue his success as a national champion.

title: Major crackdown on immigrants in Gujarat: Over 500 Bangladeshi nationals detained
content: Gujarat authorities have detained over 550 undocumented Bangladeshi immigrants in a statewide crackdown, with significant operations in Surat and Ahmedabad. The raids, involving multiple police units, targeted individuals living with forged documents, who will be deported after investigation. This action aligns with a broader national effort, including a Delhi Police probe into illegal immigration networks, reflecting concerns over national security.

title: IPL qualification scenarios: Can CSK reach the playoffs?
content: Chennai Super Kings' IPL 2025 playoff aspirations faced a significant setback after a five-wicket defeat to Sunrisers Hyderabad. This loss positions them at the bottom of the table with only four points from nine matches. While mathematically a playoff berth is still possible, CSK needs to win all remaining five games and rely on favourable outcomes from other matches.

title: ‘Either water will flow or their blood will': Ex-Pak FM Bhutto's threat to India
content: Following a deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam and India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, former Pakistani foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari threatened India, asserting Pakistan's claim to the Indus River. Tensions have escalated, leading to internal discord in Pakistan over water projects and India initiating the repatriation of Pakistani nationals. Both nations are preparing for potential international disputes.

title: Morning news wrap: Trump addresses India-Pak tensions, terrorists' homes blown up & more
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Donald Trump voiced concern over the India-Pakistan conflict, hoping for resolution. India retaliated by demolishing properties of suspected terrorists, while Pakistan threatened India over the Indus Waters Treaty suspension. In other news, MS Dhoni expressed frustration after a CSK loss, and Virginia Giuffre, known for her role in exposing Jeffrey Epstein, has died by suicide.

title: Pak Flag Removed From Desk Where Now-Suspended Simla Agreement Was Signed
content: The glossy wooden table on which the Simla Agreement was signed is kept at the Kirti Hall in the Raj Bhawan in Shimla.

title: Shops Set On Fire In Rajasthan After Man Shot Dead In Road Rage, Internet Suspended
content: Authorities in Jhalawar suspended the internet after several shops were set on fire as a consequence of the alleged gunning down of a 20-year-old local videographer by some unidentified people in a road rage, officials said on Friday.

title: Houses Of 5 Terrorists Across J&K Razed Days After Pahalgam Attack
content: The actions were taken in Shopian, Kulgam, and Pulwama districts as the security forces have intensified the crackdown on LeT operatives and suspects linked to the deadly Pahalgam attack.

title: Aviation Watchdog Advises Airlines On Passenger Services Amid Airspace Closure
content: Aviation watchdog DGCA on Saturday issued an advisory to airlines on providing proper communication and in-flight catering services to passengers as international flights are having longer flying time due to the Pakistan airspace closure.

title: Delhi NEET Aspirant Who Died In Kota Had Refused To Sit For Exam This Year
content: The man and his wife had been in the city just a few days ago to take his NEET-aspirant son back home, but he had refused.

title: Pahalgam Attack Updates: Trump Says J&K Attack "Was Bad One”; UNSC Sends Strong Message
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan have soared after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir left 26 people dead this week.

title: Kavya Maran's explosive reaction after Dhoni's genius tactic
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad defeated Chennai Super Kings by five wickets, keeping their playoff hopes alive while virtually knocking CSK out of the tournament. SRH chased down CSK's 154-run target in 18.4 overs, marking their first-ever win at the MA Chidambaram Stadium. With the victory, SRH leapfrogged Rajasthan Royals to move into seventh place on the points table. Meanwhile, CSK, with just two wins from nine matches, are all but out of the tournament.

title: Video: Russian general Yaroslav Moskalik killed in car blast near Moscow
content: A senior Russian general, Yaroslav Moskalik, was assassinated in a car bombing near Moscow, prompting accusations from Russia that Ukrainian special services were responsible. This marks the second such attack on high-ranking Russian military officials in recent months.

title: FWICE demands blanket ban on Pakistani artistes; says 'Nation comes first'
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, 2025, which claimed 26 innocent lives, the Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has called for a complete ban on Pakistani artists working in India. Ashoke Dubey, General Secretary of FWICE, emphasized national interest and urged the government to charge Indian artists collaborating with Pakistani performers with treason.

title: 'CSK got it wrong at the IPL auction': Fleming breaks silence
content: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) head coach Stephen Fleming has taken responsibility for the team's poor performance in the IPL 2025, admitting unsuccessful auction outcomes and urging players to improve. Highlighting injuries, form issues, and an unsettled strategy as key factors, Fleming acknowledged CSK's struggles after a five-wicket defeat to Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH).

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 'Trousers of 20 men pulled down to find out faith before killings'
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, a grim discovery was made: the trousers of approximately 20 male victims were unzipped or pulled down. Officials believe this indicates terrorists attempted to ascertain the victims' faith before their execution.

title: NFL draft first round pulls 13.6 million viewers
content: The 2025 NFL Draft captivated audiences, drawing 13.6 million viewers and marking the second-most watched opening round in its history, an 11% increase from 2024. Held in Green Bay with 205,000 fans in attendance, the draft embodies hope and possibility, uniting fans in anticipation of football's future stars and the promise of a fresh start for every team.

title: Virginia Giuffre, who accused Epstein & Prince Andrew of abuse, dies by suicide
content: Virginia Giuffre, a prominent voice against Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking ring and accuser of Prince Andrew, has tragically died by suicide at 41. Her family confirmed her passing at their farm in Western Australia, citing lifelong sexual abuse and sex trafficking as contributing factors.

title: IPL 2025: After RCB, DC, CSK suffer another low at Chepauk against SRH
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad defeated Chennai Super Kings at Chepauk, marking their first-ever win at the venue in IPL history and keeping their playoff hopes alive. CSK, on the other hand, suffered their joint-highest number of home defeats in a single season, dimming their chances of reaching the top four.

title: SEVIS being restored in US; relief for impacted Indian students
content: The Trump administration has seemingly reversed its controversial SEVIS termination policy, reactivating records for numerous international students across the U.S., even those not involved in lawsuits. This shift follows widespread criticism and legal challenges to the abrupt terminations, which were often based on questionable NCIC data.

title: Probe killing of man in interfaith romance: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has mandated a fresh investigation into the 2022 death of Ziaul Rahman, overturning previous court orders that applied a lesser charge. Citing the autopsy report detailing 14 injuries, the SC has directed that murder charges be framed. The court has given Uttar Pradesh six weeks to complete the trial and appoint a special prosecutor.

title: Govt revokes 14 categories of visas for Pakistani nationals
content: India has suspended visa services for Pakistani nationals, effective immediately, and revoked most existing visas following the Pahalgam attack. Exceptions include diplomatic, official, and long-term visas. Pakistani citizens holding other visa types must leave India by specific deadlines in late April, or face legal action under the new Immigration & Foreigners Act, 2025.

title: Delhi waqf board properties rose from 9 to 1,047 in 12 yrs
content: The Union government informed the Supreme Court that a 2013 amendment to the Waqf Act, which removed the bar on enforcing rights over unregistered waqfs, led to a significant increase in Waqf Board properties nationwide. Properties surged from 2,07,394 to 8,72,870, and the area expanded from 18.

title: J&K: Houses of 3 Pahalgam terrorists demolished
content: Jammu and Kashmir administration demolished the houses of three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack. The houses belonged to Adil Hussain Thoker, Asif Sheikh, and Ahsan Sheikh. Authorities ensured no family members were inside during the demolitions. This action aims to deter local terrorism and support for terror. The administration warns of further consequences for those who join terror ranks.

title: ‘Jaat’ Box Office collection: Sunny Deol-starrer records its lowest on third Friday
content: Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda's action drama 'Jaat,' released on April 10, 2025, has grossed Rs 81.6 crore after a 16-day theatrical run. While the film initially performed well, its box office collection has slowed down, earning only Rs 85 lakh on its third Friday. 'Jaat' also faced competition from 'Kesari Chapter 2' and the newly released 'Ground Zero'.

title: Fans speculate Taylor's romance with Travis is building up to a breakup album
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's high-profile romance has sparked speculation among fans, with some believing it's a prelude to Swift's next heartbreak album. The couple's very public displays of affection and constant media attention mirror Swift's past patterns of turning personal pain into chart-topping music.

title: Biryani seller shot; 'Pahalgam avenged': Killer
content: Following the murder of restaurant worker Gulfam Ali in Agra, Manoj Chaudhary, claiming affiliation with 'Kshatriya Gau Raksha Dal,' asserted responsibility, citing it as retaliation for the Pahalgam attack. He threatened further violence in a widely circulated video. However, Agra police dismissed the claims, labeling it a publicity stunt, and attributed the crime to a prior dispute over food quality.

title: Maruti goes slow on new plant amid sluggish sales
content: Maruti Suzuki is slowing down land acquisition for its second Gujarat factory, a Rs 35,000-crore project, due to sluggish car sales growth. Chairman R C Bhargava stated that current expansion plans in Haryana and Gujarat are sufficient, given the market's 1-2% growth.

title: ‘Angels sent by God’: Kashmiriyat lives on as pony 'wallah', guide, locals shield guests from harm
content: As tourists and families of victims from across the country reached home from Kashmir and outrage spread, stories of locals helping those who were stuck in the terrifying ordeal flooded in.

title: Two held for raping, blackmailing Bhopal college students with ‘fake identities’; SIT formed
content: According to the police, the incident came to light after two sisters, students at a private college in Bhopal, lodged a complaint at Bagsewania police station on April 18

title: Respite for Telangana as thunderstorm predicted in 25 districts, including Hyderabad
content: The development comes after several districts recorded extreme temperatures on Friday, with five districts crossing the 45 degrees Celsius mark.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: ‘Blood will flow if India stops river water,’ threatens Bilawal Bhutto
content: ‘The Indus is ours and will remain ours - either our water will flow through it, or their blood,’ Pakistan Peoples Party  Chairman Bilawal Bhutto-Zardariwas quoted as saying.

title: India will give befitting reply to people responsible for Pahalgam terror attack: Nadda
content: BJP President Nadda seeks blessings for a strong response to Pahalgam terror attack, hoping for PM Modi’s leadership

title: Pahalgam killings spark fresh wave of polarisation and communal politics in Bengal
content: “One form of fundamentalism breeds another. We must not let martyrdom be used as fuel for hatred,” said CPI(M) leader Sujan Chakraborty.

title: Rozgar Mela: ‘It’s a time for unprecedented opportunities for youth,’ says PM Modi
content: Addressing the 15th edition of Rozgar Mela after distributing over 51,000 appointment letters to recruits in different departments of the central government, Mr. Modi said the production and export in automobile and footwear industries have hit new records, generating employment in huge numbers.

title: A total of 228 Pakistanis living in Madhya Pradesh will have to leave India before April 27 deadline, says official
content: India has announced the revoking of all visas issued to Pakistani nationals as tension between the two countries has escalated over the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Airspace curbs: DGCA issues advisory to airlines on passenger services due to longer flights
content: Pakistan has closed its airspace for Indian airlines, resulting in longer flying hours for their international flights, especially those flying out from north Indian cities

title: Families caught in the crossfire after Indian Government asks Pakistani nationals to leave the country
content: Bajida Khan learnt that while her sons can cross the border holding Pakistani passports, she with an Indian passport can no longer cross over

title: Nitish Kumar cabinet clears ₹15,995 crore subsidy to power consumers
content: The cabinet has also approved Bihar Vishesh Sarvekshan Evam Bandobast (Sanshodhan) Niyamawali 2025 (Bihar Special Survey and Settlement (Amendment) Rules 2025) which will allow farmers to exchange their land.

title: Measles: Incidence on the decline in Karnataka, but pockets in BBMP and Ballari record higher number of cases
content: Measles and rubella are highly infectious viral diseases that can lead to serious illnesses, lifelong complications, and even death

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde extends assistance of ₹5 lakh to family of Kashmiri youth killed
content: Shiv Sena workers and the Border Authorities, met the family of the deceased and handed over the compensation. Local MLA Syed Rafiq Shah was also present during the visit

title: Historian MGS Narayanan passes away
content: Proficient in Vattezhuthu, the syllabic alphabet of South India and Sri Lanka as well as Kolezhuthu, the syllabic alphabet of Kerala used for writing Malayalam language, he had also possessed a deep knowledge of Sanskrit

title: CBI arrests two persons, including IRS official, on charge of attempting to sabotage IT faceless assessment scheme
content: According to the CBI, the two along others were contacting various assessees of pending high value IT assessment cases, promising favourable orders in lieu of pecuniary benefits.

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistan Defence Minister demands international probe, NYT reports
content: Pakistan’s Defence Minister Khawaja Muhammad Asif has accused India of taking steps to punish Pakistan "without any proof, without any investigation".

title: Four cadres of banned outfits in Manipur held
content: Acting on a tip-off, police personnel apprehended two cadres of the banned Prepak (Pro) from Seijang Mayai Leikai and Tellou Mamang Leikai areas in Imphal East district

title: U.N. Security Council 'strongly condemns' Pahalgam terror attack
content: UNSC condemns Jammu and Kashmir terror attack, urges accountability for perpetrators, organisers, and sponsors of terrorism

title: Odisha targets to triple steel production by 2030, says CM Mohan Majhi
content: The State is planning to auction 22 mines to attract fresh investment, said Mohan Charan Majhi, Chief Minister of Odisha during this visit to Mumbai.

title: Over 450 illegal immigrants detained in Ahmedabad
content: The police carried out a combing operation in different localities in the wee hours of  April 26 and rounded up foreign immigrants who were residing Ahmedabad illegally

title: One girl dies after falling into Periyar river, another rescued
content: ‘The siblings were out for a morning walk..and probably went down to the river to take selfie,’ say police

title: Hyderabad police denies permission for ‘Telangana March’ at Tank Bund
content: According to the Additional Commissioner of Police (Law and Order), the decision was taken due to anticipated traffic disruptions in central parts of the city

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire along LoC in Kashmir, army responds appropriately: Defence official
content: Pakistan Army violated ceasefire in Kashmir, prompting Indian army response; no casualties reported, defense official confirms

title: TDP leader takes up Paleti bridge, Muktyala Lift Irrigation scheme with Naidu
content: NTR district TDP president Nettem Raghuram also discusses with the Chief Minister the plight of Inam land owners

title: BJP driving a wedge between Hindus and Muslims, alleges APCC chief Sharmila
content: Centre should own responsibility for loss of innocent civilian lives in Pahalgam terrorist attack and step down, she says

title: There has always been tension between India, Pak; they'll get it figured out: Trump
content: The U.S. Donald Trump was asked about tensions between India and Pakistan in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: The Resistance Front denies involvement in attack, blames Indian intel for earlier claim
content: Pakistan Defence Minister says in NYT interview that Pakistan was “ready to cooperate” with “any investigation which is conducted by international inspectors.”

title: Pahalgam terror attack: The meadow cries out in fear and grief
content: Baisaran, surrounded by the mighty Himalayas that stand against an azure sky, has fallen silent. Here, on April 22, terrorists killed 24 tourists from across India, one from Nepal, and one local man who tried to protect them. Peerzada Ashiq reports on how, four days after, those who lost loved ones are in disbelief, the country collectively rages, while the people of Kashmir grieve the loss of a delicate peace

title: A.P. government urged to relax norms for DSC-2025 recruitment drive
content: Demands include removal of minimum qualifying marks criteria, extension of preparation time to 90 days and increasing the maximum age limit to 47 years

title: Former MP Nani calls defamation suit ‘intimidation tactic’, says he will not be cowered down
content: A defamation suit was filed against Kesineni Srinivas by his brother and Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath in connection with the allegations made regarding the land allocation to Ursa Clusters

title: A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan launches projects worth ₹100 crore in Pithapuram Assembly constituency
content: Pawan Kalyan performs bhumi puja for Pithapuram Area Hospital, TTD Kalyana Mandapam, and otehr developmental works

title: RSS like-minded U.S.-based Hindu American organisation releases documentary to debunk caste myths in India
content: Removing caste discrimination from the Hindu society has been a long pending agenda of the RSS as its chief Mohan Bhagwat, on several occasions in the past, had pitched for “ek mandir, ek kuan, ek shamshaan”

title: Attempt to compromise safe train operations foiled, says Southern Railway
content: The attempt to tamper with the track fastenings was made in the busy Arakkonam-Chennai section, Railways said

title: Indus Waters Treaty was 'most unfair document' to people of J&K: Omar
content: Mr. Abdullah said the meeting with various tourism, trade and industry bodies condemned the killings and unitedly raised voice against such attacks

title: Encroachments around Arunachaleshwara temple in Tiruvannamalai demolished to facilitate drain work
content: Most of the encroachments, around 160 structures, on these stretches had been built over two decades ago

title: Faecal contamination beyond permissible limits in Kadambrayar, Chitrapuzha
content: Action plan initiated to check pollution. Directives for setting up sewage treatment plants to be issued; penalty to be imposed on those violating rules under the Water Act

title: Heart surgeries performed on 15 children at Andhra Hospitals
content: Doctors at the paediatric intensive care unit of the Andhra Hospitals have performed about 600 heart surgeries for children over the past few years

title: India’s decision on Indus casts shadow on renewal of India-Bangladesh Ganga Water Treaty: Bangladesh water expert
content: “Renewal of the Ganga treaty will come up next year but if India continues to hold the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance then it will create doubts about India’s willingness on sharing of river waters with Bangladesh”

title: Women entrepreneurs showcase biodegradable innovations at DRDA workshop
content: Collector G. Lakshmisha assured women entrepreneurs training, loans and market linkages for their products

title: Vice-President lauds T.N. Governor at Vice-Chancellors’ meet
content: Dhankhar says Governor Ravi is vindicating his oath by organising such events, which are extremely relevant to the field of education; he emphasises national interest, calls for innovation in higher education

title: Maharashtra BJP chief denies credit war among allies over Kashmir rescue efforts
content: The Chief Minister’s Office revealed on Thursday that the State government had arranged special IndiGo and Air India flights and brought back 184 tourists to Mumbai

title: Pahalgam terror attack: At Jama Masjid, worshippers join Mirwaiz to observe one-minute silence for victims
content: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, CM Omar Abdullah denounce attacks on people of J&K elsewhere in nation; ministers deputed to various cities to ensure their safety

title: Kasturirangan took space to people, and beyond
content: Under Dr. Kasturirangan, Indian space programme smoothly graduated from the experimental  phase to operational phase in the areas of earth observation satellites and communication satellites

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Baisaran meadow was always open to public, police permit never sought, says J&K official
content: Baisaran operated by district authority; CRPF tells MPs there is no permanent deployment in upper reaches except during Amarnath yatra; IB says “loose LeT groups are active in upper reaches”

title: Samsung to make further investments, says T.N. Minister
content: The news comes at a time after workers staged a protest in February this year after a few employees were suspended

title: Haryana steps up security measures following Pahalgam terror attack
content: Chief Secretary directs vigilance against anti-social elements; DGP calls for revival of peace committees to maintain harmony

title: Will support India as it hunts for those responsible for Pahalgam attack: Tulsi Gabbard
content: We stand in solidarity with India in the wake of the horrific Islamist terrorist attack, targeting and killing 26 Hindus in Pahalgam, says U.S. Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard

title: Govt. revokes 14 categories of visas given to Pakistani nationals
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday called up all the Chief Ministers and asked them to ensure that no Pakistani stays in their States beyond the deadline set for leaving the country.

title: Karnataka HC restrains State and Bescom from mandatory implementation of high-cost smart meters for permanent electricity connections
content: The decision of Bescom is contrary to the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission’s regulation, the court pointed out

title: M.P. farmers to be excluded from CM Kisan Kalyan Scheme if they resort to stubble burning
content: The growing practice of burning crop residue (narwai) after harvest is causing severe environmental damage, says CM Mohan Yadav

title: DRDO makes headway in hypersonic technology
content: The long-duration Active Cooled Scramjet Subscale Combustor ground testing was achieved for more than 1,000 seconds

title: NBA playoff odds: Thunder up 3-0 on Memphis, solidify championship favorite status
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers and Minnesota Timberwolves have the second-best odds to take home the title . they are up 2-0 in their opening round series with the Orlando Magic .

title: NIA searches 18 locations in Pakistan-backed arms & drugs smuggling case
content: Searches span five States and one Union Territory; agency says it seized electronic devices and other incriminating materials

title: Kasturirangan had a distinct connect with Malnad region
content: He had visited parts of the area before submitting report on Western Ghats as head of the high-level committee

title: Why was PM campaigning in Bihar instead of attending all-party meet, ask Trinamool MPs

title: Police conduct cordon and search operations in Kurnool

title: Naidu invites Modi for relaunch of Amaravati works, extends solidarity in wake of Pahalgam attack
content: We are with you, and the whole country stands with you in whatever decision you take in the interest of the nation, CM tells PM

title: No delays, no excuses: Telangana begins deportation of 33 Pakistani nationals
content: While the Attari border remains the designated land exit point for Pakistani nationals until April 30, those travelling by air must depart via Delhi or Mumbai. Passengers flying out of Hyderabad will need to transit through Saudi Arabia or Dubai.

title: Kerala government amends liquor rules to allow sale of legal liquor in State-owned IT parks
content: At a stroke, the government appears to hold forth a salve to assuage the software and start-up sectors’ longstanding grievance that the lack of high-spirited socialising venues rendered Kerala a dull job destination for techies

title: The time is now: Projecting John Cena's final WWE matches
content: the last time in his career, John Cena has won a title for the 17th time in 2025 . the biggest storyline in WWE will be surrounding his quest to bring the title home with him "forever" we don't know, but wrestling fans love to make predictions and that's what we will do here .

title: What's at stake across the top leagues: Titles, cup finals, UCL, relegation
content: a roundup of what's at stake, and what could be decided, in the English Premier League , German Bundesliga , Spanish LaLiga , Italian Serie A and French Ligue 1 . most teams have played 33 games going into the weekend . the top five will qualify for the U.S. champions league .

title: Clásico combined XI: Which Barcelona, Real Madrid stars make the cut?
content: the two rivals meet in the copa del Rey final on saturday . the pair have a combined XI based on this season's form and talked through their selections . if given the chance, which players would each manager like to take from their rivals?

title: Western Conference playoffs: Wolves rout Lakers, take 2-1 lead
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on friday, the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder completed a historic comeback to go up 3-0 in the series against the No. 8 seed Memphis Grizzlies .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Magic, Bucks win Game 3s to extend series
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the Finals . the no. 3 seed New York Knicks dropped their first game at home after 61 points combined .

title: This weekend's spring game previews: Oregon, Penn State and more

title: Why Jags went all-in on Travis Hunter at the NFL draft: Will he play both sides of the ball?
content: the Jacksonville Jaguars knew early in the pre-NFL draft process that they wanted Travis Hunter . but he didn't think they'd be able to pull it off, knowing he'd have to trade up from no. 5 overall . he called the Cleveland Browns several weeks ago to see if they could work out a deal .

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
